content:
@James Agnew You're probably already working this, but I'm having trouble loading the StructureDefinitions and IG artifacts from the very latest US Core release: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1/

The stack trace I'm getting:

       Caused by:
        ca.uhn.fhir.parser.DataFormatException: Invalid attribute value "4.0.1": Unknown FHIRVersion code '4.0.1'
            at ca.uhn.fhir.parser.StrictErrorHandler.invalidValue(StrictErrorHandler.java:49)
            at ca.uhn.fhir.parser.ParserState$PrimitiveState.attributeValue(ParserState.java:1236)
            at ca.uhn.fhir.parser.ParserState.attributeValue(ParserState.java:66)
            at ca.uhn.fhir.parser.JsonParser.parseChildren(JsonParser.java:1097)
            at ca.uhn.fhir.parser.JsonParser.parseChildren(JsonParser.java:1002)
            at ca.uhn.fhir.parser.JsonParser.doParseResource(JsonParser.java:196)
            at ca.uhn.fhir.parser.JsonParser.doParseResource(JsonParser.java:178)
            at ca.uhn.fhir.parser.BaseParser.parseResource(BaseParser.java:703)
            at ca.uhn.fhir.parser.BaseParser.parseResource(BaseParser.java:757)

HAPI is apparently puking when the StructureDefinition.fhirVersion = "4.0.1"

I'm using the 4.1.0-SNAPSHOT libraries from Maven.
needs an update to the latest fhir-core
